meanings.definition: A person who is in a state of catatonia.
meanings.sent1: The catatonics in the hospital seemed very still and unresponsive.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient as a catatonics after observing their lack of movement.
meanings.sent3: The catatonics at the party was the one who never danced and just sat quietly in the corner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a room full of catatonics, frozen in time and unable to move.
meanings.sent5: The catatonics in the horror movie haunted the dreams of the viewers with their eerie stillness.
